abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for this project are: the
            project's outcome is satisfactory, project
            sustainability is unlikely, institutional development impact
            is modest, and the performances of the Bank and the Borrower
            are both satisfactory. Some of the general lessons learned
            from this project include the following: Learning and
            Innovation Loans (LILs) can be catalysts to introduce
            significant/important reforms on a minor scale, to learn
            from the process prior to scaling up good practice outcomes
            in subsequent operations, and to commence policy dialogue.
            Supporting client's initiatives through technical
            assistance to scale up pilots even as they are being
            implemented can help to replicate good ideas. 2) Under
            post-conflict circumstances, a first time operation in a
            sector should be strategically focused, financing only some
            key interventions and not include all pressing needs in the
            operation since with increased complexity implementation
            suffers delays. With a LIL there is a pressing need to
            obtain in a short time the learning and innovation knowledge
            for a major follow-up operation. In post-conflict LIL
            operations, human and institutional capacity building should
            be given equal importance as improving infrastructure and
            educational materials. 3) Complex components such as
            Education Management Information System (EMIS) and student
            assessments typically require time to design, implement,
            fine-tune and evaluate. Ideally, these aspects should
            feature prominently as major components (rather than as
            small components) of a LIL with sufficient funding and
            technical assistance allocated for these important
            components. 4) A LIL offers a good starting point to build
            capacity in post-conflict situations particularly in the
            context of weak institutional arrangements since it allows
            the opportunity to pilot innovations. 5) In post-conflict
            circumstances and first time sector operations, procurement
            must receive utmost attention from the project preparation
            stage. Missions should, jointly with government, prepare the
            first year procurement plan and have the first package for
            tendering completed at project effectiveness. Greatest use
            should be made of standard bidding documents. 6) The
            inclusion of an architect/civil engineer during preparation
            and supervision can help to avoid civil works problems such
            as cost overrides and helping to keep up the momentum of
            implementation. In addition, such staffing could have
            advanced standard designs for construction and standard
            bidding documents prior to effectiveness thereby avoiding
            start-up problems.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Reform Project for
            Tajikistan aims to improve access to high quality education
            as well as to raise learning achievements of students. The
            project has three components. The first builds capacity by
            training teacher trainers and providing in-service training
            in teacher methodologies in pilot school, supporting parent
            meetings, and providing management training in methodology
            for the education ministry and school administrations. The
            second component reforms the system of textbook development,
            publishing, and distribution to improve the availability of
            good quality textbooks, refurbishes educational institutions
            and the ministry and provides school equipment, and funds
            civil works and teacher-training centers. The third
            component, pilot management, finances local consultant
            services, equipment, and project audits as well as project
            monitoring and evaluation.
